Articles.Content:
That is a cave? O.o

It looks more like a very large mun arch that's going through the terrain.

Try to look underground...
Oh for the monument on Vall has anyone else tried standing on top of all the buildings there? I was thinking it may be worth a go

Mm I'm facing my next problem. Which easter egg should I first go for.

I'm now very distracted by that 'cave' thing.
Trust me, the cave is not just an arch. You can go inside it, but it's closed and the structure is mostly underground.

Why should they be disguised so hard? I think mapsat is the perfect balance between frustrating and no fun because too easy.

That wouldn't make sense.

MapSat simulates radar mapping, which would detect and report on anomalies
What are the coordinates for the pyramid?

Trust me, the cave is not just an arch. You can go inside it, but it's closed and the structure is mostly underground.

Is it on the mun? cant really make out the location on the screenshot.

Is it on the mun? cant really make out the location on the screenshot.

The caves on Tylo

The caves on Tylo

Ok thanks, im preparing for a mission as we speak

Even with MapSat, finding the anomolies is challenging considering the dot covers at least a dozen km^2. I spent a lot of time looking for one of the munoliths on Kerbin using it without realizing that I needed to look up a bit to actually see it.

There's every chance the easter-eggs may be moved in future updates too. And possibly to harder to reach areas like the lower elevations of Moho or on steep inclinations with no viable landing spots for a few km around it. I also wouldn't be surprised if Nova "accidentally" puts a few dozen underground as "red-herrings" after all this.

Edited October 1, 2012 by Maddmatts

mapsat as it is makes logical sense, and i get it, im not even against it, i just dont want to use it, not even for terrain mapping, i just prefer to recon things myself. for me tis as easy as not installing.

now as for why i would want some things hidden?

it just more awesome to have little gems hidden in the game that are discovered by total accident. that doesnt happen with mapsat because players will discover them, and they will be known, and /17 discovries took very VERY little time to discover, which makes the easter egg itself, less awesome.

imagine how great it would be for a patch to come out, mapsat users find some things and its all hurray huzzah thats cool sweet dude high fives alla round, except for jimmy, cause he didnt wash after he flushed. then, a couple weeks, maybe a month or longer downt he road, this amazing thing was found, that mapsat couldnt pick up, it was well hidden (imagine something as awesome as the magic boulder or the sstv) and then someone comes on andsuddenly there this amazing thing in the game, thats been there this whole time noone ever knew about, people were at the phase of the games where they were not even looking for things, someone just foud it.

those types of discoveries are the best, because its exciting, its amazing.
Did you try to land on it?

I got a rather clean audio file from that pyramid on Duna. I posted about it on IRC earlier today but if anybody here feels like giving a try at decoding it here it is:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/0duj3q4xgsta4tw/duna%20sstv.mp3

I just got a theory. It might have been mentioned but what if the what if those there space bodies where the magic bolder seen for different angles. The redish sphere would be Duna and those bodies above it might be the bolder seen at different angles. There seems to be something weird happening with it. Green rips across it surface. Maybe it holds some magical powers or possibly was maybe those green rips are the left overs of what looks like a laser pointing to it.

Yeah, unfortunately it doesn't seem to be possible. The only solid portion of the collision mesh appears to be in front of the boulder and any landing attempts from that direction results in you watching your craft explode part by part as you slowly approach. From any other direction you sink through the boulder until you hit the front and are flung at high speed away minus a few parts.

I got a rather clean audio file from that pyramid on Duna. I posted about it on IRC earlier today but if anybody here feels like giving a try at decoding it here it is:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/0duj3q4xgsta4tw/duna%20sstv.mp3

Har Har.

YES!!!! I FINALLY DID IT!!!

I had to build this thing

Which ends up doing

So I can land in many different places

I've spent the last 3 weeks(!!!) trying to find one of these, landing on the other large craters with my regular lander and taking off when I realised that was taking me too much time. So instead I built a ship to handle it all and now I got it . Now I just need to find the other two and I'll be happy with Mun.

Then Minmus

I just found something!

[ATTACH=CONFIG]34038[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]34039[/ATTACH]

i guess that's the boulder right?

EDIT: seems like you can't see it very well :/

Over the DEMV there is a tiny white speck, i think that might be the boulder?

Ei, DonKamillo! You found something in Duna approximate coordinates -31 N -28.8 E?

Ciao!!

Tbh, the thing isn't there anymore? but since i read somewhere that the boulder moves around randomly i guess that might be it.

For the coordinates, wait a moment i'll look it up

EDIT: Duna Mapsat #1 says the coordinates are -30.6 N -28.8 E.... so yeah it's somewhere around there.

EDIT2: Bing! sudden realization the anomaly shown by mapsat is not on the ground (where i have been searching) but instead in the air

wow i'm stupid^^

Moves around randomly eh? I'm gonna bring my theory up again that you can encounter this "randomly" moving boulder when the 3 inner planets allign, and fly from the pyramid, or some kind of point from Duna or maybe Ike up, can you then encounter the boulder?
One other thing. Someone posted a map of Eve where there was a pretty deep spot in the ocean. Maybe that's worth looking for too?
